info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 29 at 3:33AM EST until January 29 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Storm total snowfall in excess of a foot in many areas. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The coastal counties of New Jersey and Sussex County in Delaware. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow, strong winds, and severely reduced visibilities will continue this morning. Snow will end this afternoon. However, winds will remain strong, creating considerable blowing and drifting snow through late afternoon.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
